Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3563/A.2367, to expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members (S.3563/A.2367).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation to lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation that would expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, A.7851, and the Governor to sign, S.2534/A.7851, which retroactively freezes the rent at which a SCRIE or DRIE enrollee pays at the level it was when they first became eligible, or at the level it was two years before they entered the program, given that entrance into the program occurred more than two years after they first became eligible.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Retroactively freezes the rent at which a SCRIE or DRIE enrollee pays at the level it was when they first became eligible, or at the level it was two years before they entered the program (S.2534/ A.7851)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3563/A.2367, to expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members (S.3563/A.2367).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3563/A.2367, to expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3563/A.2367, to expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved by Committee
Items.MatterName: Expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members (S.3563/A.2367).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation to lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Approved by Committee
Items.MatterName: Lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation that would expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, A.7851, and the Governor to sign, S.2534/A.7851, which retroactively freezes the rent at which a SCRIE or DRIE enrollee pays at the level it was when they first became eligible, or at the level it was two years before they entered the program, given that entrance into the program occurred more than two years after they first became eligible.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
